s.text: Without elevating these often petty struggles into a war of "ideas," it may be worth asking: What are these people ripping themselves up about?

Without elevating these often petty struggles into a war of "ideas," it may be worth asking: What are these people ripping themselves up about?

Both groups have long wished for conservatives to do what William Bennett and John DiIulio Jr. recommend they do in the new issue of Commentary : make peace with the New Deal and get on with their lives.
No sacrifice is ever asked of the public.
No sacrifice is ever asked of the public.
The editor of the American Spectator fired the publisher, apparently for asking too many questions about how the magazine spent grants from the far-right Scaife Foundation.
